description: 20 prompts testing edge cases: empty blueprints, unusual node combos, ambiguous prompts, maximum complexity, error recovery patterns, uncommon events.

prompts.instruction: Create the simplest possible Blueprint. Just an actor with BeginPlay that does nothing else.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Empty
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay uses a Sequence with 4 outputs. Each output prints a different number: 1, 2, 3, 4.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FourPrints
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Sequence
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="1"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="2"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="3"]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="4"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_2 -> n5.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_3 -> n6.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay waits 1 second, prints First, waits 2 more seconds, prints Second, waits 3 more seconds, prints Third.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TripleDelay
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=1.0]
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="First"]
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Second"]
NODE n6: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Third"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Completed -> n7.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with no variables. On overlap print Hello. On end overlap print Goodbye. On Tick print Alive.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_NoVars
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Hello"]
NODE n3: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Goodbye"]
NODE n5: Event_Tick
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Alive"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with string Name set to Player, int Level set to 1, float Health set to 100, and bool IsAlive set to true. On BeginPlay print the Name.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MultiVars
PARENT: Actor
VAR Name: String = "Player"
VAR Level: Int = 1
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
VAR IsAlive: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Name]
NODE n3: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with three custom events: OnAttack, OnDefend, OnHeal. OnAttack prints Attacking. OnDefend prints Defending. OnHeal prints Healing.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ThreeEvents
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Custom [EventName=OnAttack]
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Attacking"]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=OnDefend]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Defending"]
NODE n5: Event_Custom [EventName=OnHeal]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Healing"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay calls DestroyActor on self, which should be the entire graph. Just two nodes and one exec connection.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ImmediateDestroy
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on pressing Toggle uses FlipFlop. Path A prints ON and sets bool State to true. Path B prints OFF and sets State to false.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleState
PARENT: Actor
VAR State: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Toggle"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="ON"]
NODE n4: VariableSet [VarName=State]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="OFF"]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=State]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA true -> n4.Value [Bool]
EXEC n2.B -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA false -> n6.Value [Bool]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap uses DoOnce to print First Time. On pressing Reset, reset the DoOnce so it can fire again.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DoOnceReset
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: DoOnce
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="First Time"]
NODE n4: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Reset"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n4.Pressed -> n2.Reset

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with float Speed at 10 and float Multiplier at 2. On BeginPlay multiply Speed by Multiplier and print the result.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DataCalc
PARENT: Actor
VAR Speed: Float = 10.0
VAR Multiplier: Float = 2.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Speed]
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Multiplier]
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat
NODE n5: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n3.Value -> n4.B [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Make a light switch. When pressed it turns the light on or off.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LightSwitch
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Use"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetVisibility [NewVisibility=true]
NODE n4: SetVisibility [NewVisibility=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute

prompts.instruction: Make something the player can pick up that gives them points.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PointPickup
PARENT: Actor
VAR Points: Int = 10
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Points]
NODE n4: PrintString
NODE n5: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.InString [String]
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with a Gate. On pressing Open, open the gate. On pressing Close, close it. On pressing Toggle, toggle it. On Tick enter the gate. Gate exit prints Passing.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FullGate
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Open"]
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Close"]
NODE n4: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Toggle"]
NODE n5: Event_Tick
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Passing"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n2.Close
EXEC n4.Pressed -> n2.Toggle
EXEC n5.Then -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n6.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on pressing Next uses MultiGate with 3 outputs cycling. Output 0 prints Red. Output 1 prints Green. Output 2 prints Blue.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ColorCycle
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Next"]
NODE n2: MultiGate [Loop=true]
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Red"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Green"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Blue"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_2 -> n5.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on pressing Jump prints Jumped. On pressing Crouch prints Crouched. Both events are independent.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TwoInputs
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Jump"]
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Jumped"]
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Crouch"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Crouched"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n4.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay gets its own location, gets its own display name, and prints both.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SelfInfo
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: GetDisplayName
NODE n4: PrintString
NODE n5: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n4.InString [String]
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n5.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap tries CastToCharacter. If that succeeds print Character. If fails try CastToPawn. If that succeeds print Pawn. If both fail print Unknown.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DualCast
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Character"]
NODE n4: CastToPawn
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Pawn"]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Unknown"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.CastFailed -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n4.Object [Actor]
EXEC n4.CastSucceeded -> n5.Execute
EXEC n4.CastFailed -> n6.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap uses DoOnce. Inside DoOnce, use another DoOnce. First prints First Visit. Second prints Bonus. So first overlap triggers both, subsequent overlaps trigger nothing.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_NestedDoOnce
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: DoOnce
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="First Visit"]
NODE n4: DoOnce
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Bonus"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with float A at 10, float B at 3. On BeginPlay compute A plus B, A minus B, A times B, A divided by B. Print each result using Sequence.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MathOps
PARENT: Actor
VAR A: Float = 10.0
VAR B: Float = 3.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=A]
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=B]
NODE n4: Sequence
NODE n5: AddFloat
NODE n6: PrintString
NODE n7: SubtractFloat
NODE n8: PrintString
NODE n9: MultiplyFloat
NODE n10: PrintString
NODE n11: DivideFloat
NODE n12: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then_0 -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n3.Value -> n5.B [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.InString [String]
EXEC n4.Then_1 -> n8.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n7.A [Float]
DATA n3.Value -> n7.B [Float]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.InString [String]
EXEC n4.Then_2 -> n10.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n9.A [Float]
DATA n3.Value -> n9.B [Float]
DATA n9.ReturnValue -> n10.InString [String]
EXEC n4.Then_3 -> n12.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n11.A [Float]
DATA n3.Value -> n11.B [Float]
DATA n11.ReturnValue -> n12.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a character Blueprint with Health at 100, string Name. On BeginPlay print the name. On AnyDamage subtract. If health below 0 print dead and destroy. On overlap with pickup add 25 health.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FullCharacter
PARENT: Character
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
VAR Name: String = "Hero"
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Name]
NODE n3: PrintString
NODE n4: Event_AnyDamage
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n6: SubtractFloat
NODE n7: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
NODE n8: LessThan [B=0.0]
NODE n9: Branch
NODE n10: PrintString [InString="Dead"]
NODE n11: DestroyActor
NODE n12: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n13: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n14: AddFloat [B=25.0]
NODE n15: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n4.Then -> n7.Execute
DATA n5.Value -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n4.Damage -> n6.B [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Value [Float]
EXEC n7.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n7.Value -> n8.A [Float]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n9.True -> n10.Execute
EXEC n10.Then -> n11.Execute
EXEC n12.Then -> n15.Execute
DATA n13.Value -> n14.A [Float]
DATA n14.ReturnValue -> n15.Value [Float]
